front.title: Automatic IP Multicast Without Explicit Tunnels (AMT)

abstract.t: Automatic Multicast Tunneling (AMT) allows multicast communication amongst isolated multicast-enabled sites or hosts, attached to a network which has no native multicast support. It also enables them to exchange multicast traffic with the native multicast infrastructure and does not require any manual configuration. AMT uses an encapsulation interface so that no changes to a host stack or applications are required, all protocols (not just UDP) are handled, and there is no additional overhead in core routers.
